Javan Myna.description: The Javan Myna is a common bird in Singapore. It is a noisy bird and is often seen in urban areas. It is an omnivorous bird and feeds on fruits, insects and small animals. It is a common sight to see them scavenging for food in the rubbish bins.

Little Egret.description: The Little Egret is a small white heron with a slender black bill and long black legs with yellow feet. It is a common bird in Singapore and is often seen in wetlands and coastal areas. It feeds on small fish, insects and small animals.

Collared Kingfisher.description: The Collared Kingfisher is a common bird in Singapore. It is a small bird with a large head and a long bill. It is often seen perching on trees and feeding on small animals. It is a noisy bird and is often heard calling in the early morning and late evening.

Black-naped Oriole.description: The Black-naped Oriole is a common bird in Singapore. It is a bright yellow bird with a black patch on its nape. It is often seen perching on trees and feeding on fruits and insects. It is a noisy bird and is often heard calling in the early morning and late evening.
